tweets.text: @StinkStopthe @Kamron09 @EnvAgencyMids Well done to the protestors today. How ironic that right now the stink is back big time, all windows & doors firmly closed but still being polluted in our own homes. Do they turn a tap on at night to release the obnoxious gases when they think we won‚Äôt notice?

@EnvAgency This kind of direct engagement is what is needed in Coggeshall. Come & talk to residents about natural flood management instead of forcing through the environmentally damaging, expensive quarry https://t.co/IGDSi9jRtC

@CleanIlkley @EnvAgency What is so depressing is the @EnvAgency justifying CSOs and pollution. We all know @WaterUK use CSOs whatever the weather. The #thames near Mogden STW stinks every time it rains

@EnvAgency Happening here after 20 minutes of light, everyday rainfall. Hardly a " storm" in Yorkshire. These CSO's are being used to compensate for inadequate infrastructure, polluting our environment and putting public health at risk to save privately owned water companies money.
@StinkStopthe @SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA Presumably senior @EnvAgency officials are enjoying their Easter weekend while denying it to the people of Newcastle

1) What is the white liquid being dumped? Thought liquids weren‚Äôt permitted 
2) What happened to the voluntary curtailing of works except for capping materials? 
Still not aware that the public have been given answers re the previously suspicious items being dumped @EnvAgency https://t.co/5LwYRqhuP9

Help keep our beaches #LitterFree this #BankHoliday weekend.

If a bin is full, take your rubbish home to throw away or recycle.

#RespectProtectEnjoy #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/jDF0ha77ic

urls.title: What is a storm overflow and how do they work?
urls.description: Heard of a storm overflow but not sure what it is? Watch this to find out what they are, why they operate and what we do to minimise their impact on the wate...

tweets.text:
What are storm overflows, and why do we use them?

Storm overflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our homes or streets during periods of heavy rain or storms.

Watch our video to find out more about storm overflows: https://t.co/VBJFNTBAVE
@Kamron09 @EnvAgencyMids We shouldn't have to live like this mate.

Disgraceful! Disadvantaging people at our universities & colleges now as well as the prospects of school children suffering headaches & concentration issues due to the fumes. Where is the equality? We deserve clean air! @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice https://t.co/c4eY3C4RWa

@EnvAgency data shows @AnglianWater released RAW SEWAGE into the River Lark from the Fornham All Saints STW on 16 occasions for a total of 199 hours in 2020 and from the Great Welnetham¬†STW on 15 occasions for a total of 239.75 hours. Let them know this is not acceptable!! https://t.co/YiCUH8RkG1

The stench has returned to Newcastle-under-lyme once again. It's absolutely fucking disgusting can't wait for another night with massive headaches and little sleep! Really considering moving back home early to do my final exams there. I hate this. @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids

Officers from @NewsNBC Stink Squad will be out from 11pm tonight ‚è∞ verifying & recording odour levels -  report here: https://t.co/TLecV4tpTA I will be joining them üëÉ so if you are experiencing the stink tonight state your area in the comments üëá @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL

@SianieRoo @stwater @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice I can just see them now with their excuses ready to blame it on someone else or say that they were unaware or it was an error and the EA gives another pointless breach after a long long investigation that achieves nothing. Meanwhile red giggle to themselves and think ‚Äòphew .

Our officers have been working with @SYFR 24/7 since Friday at a #fire in Burngreave, #Sheffield. Our intervention has helped contain up to 9,000 litres of water used per minute to tackle the fire, preventing it from draining to the nearby River Don and causing environmental harm https://t.co/Z0AZXg6kvA

@StinkStopthe @SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA The truth is that if this was happening in a major city, she'd already be out of a job and the EA facing an inquiry. Instead, she has reassured Red Industries there will be no consequences for what they do. I have to wonder what it will take for the EA to do its job.

@SimonTagg @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk @SimonTagg you need to start petitioning @PersimmonHomes . I‚Äôm sure that they won‚Äôt want any prospective customers knowing about the smell coming from 100 yards away from where they are building.

@EnvAgency Except we live on the river, so you‚Äôre not preventing sewage around people‚Äôs homes, you‚Äôre just shifting the problem. How would you feel if I dumped raw sewage on your doorstep? If that‚Äôs not ok, why is it acceptable for your to dump it on our doorstep?

Permit doesn‚Äôt allow liquids yet a white liquid is clearly visible gushing from bulk containers with many more containers in the background. Watch out @stwater ! We have a right to answers this time @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice https://t.co/7uLxUvLFrW

Today's protest led the @BBCmtd bulletin - great work from all the organisers.

Huge thanks to everyone who came out today to protest, or gave us a toot as they drove past.

I hope @EnvAgencyMids take note of this show of our determination and resolve.

https://t.co/OQF4PSyhjr
@WendyMa48697963 @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Shouldn‚Äôt be any liquid at all going into that site, except for rainwater. Permit doesn‚Äôt allow liquids.
@DrMickSalt @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/gGUXeVfNcO

@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Then I see this liquid gushing out - what is it ?
Surely this shouldn't go willy nilly into a landfill site.
Is it toxic is it chemical is it acid?
What's going on hear 
Can someone explain please.
@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Could you offer an explanation as to why IBC's full of liquid are being dumped in the landfill? #stopthestink #capitoff https://t.co/YJogvuquxn

Well done to @StinkStopthe for mobilising people power today. Hundreds of local people attended the protest. The @EnvAgencyMids and @PHE_uk must listen and close down Walleys Quarry landfill and move to the restoration phase of the site now! https://t.co/khbLjmEs27

@EnvAgency Oh please. At least explain the full story of storm overflows. All our filming of sewage discharges into rivers are in NON periods of heavy rain or storms. September 2000 rivers classed as 92% good as stated by your chairperson, 2020 only 14% of rivers classed as good
